repositories.brief_summary: Seven PRs merged covering GC improvements, Unix API modernization, and C callback safety fixes
repositories.new_features_summary: Unix library socket API modernization and runtime improvements for GC pacing and callback safety
repositories.new_features:
- **Unix library socket API modernization** by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) deprecating `union sock_addr_union` in favor of standard `struct sockaddr_storage` and `socklen_param_type` in favor of `socklen_t`, with backward compatibility macros for C and C++ ([#14310](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14310))
- **Runtime callback safety fix** preventing segfaults by ensuring C callback mechanism properly calls `caml_continuation_use` when handling continuations, addressing dropped continuation issues ([#14337](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14337))
- **GC ephemeron accounting improvements** removing quadratic term from ephemeron marking work calculation to improve garbage collection pacing accuracy ([#14336](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14336))
- **GC work accounting fixes** correcting domain-local work counter tracking for mark and sweep phases to prevent pacing logic errors ([#14329](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14329))
- **Runtime header improvements** making `<caml/osdeps.h>` self-standing by adding necessary includes, improving C extension compatibility ([#14342](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14342))

repositories.brief_summary: Performance improvements through lazy buffer indexing and optimized short-paths handling
repositories.new_features_summary: Lazy buffer indexing delivers 25% speedup for error queries, short-paths optimizations reduce forced substitutions
repositories.new_features:
- **Lazy buffer indexing** now only performs indexing when queries specifically require it ([#1991](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1991)), delivering approximately **25% speedup** for `ocamlmerlin single errors` queries as verified by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) in testing
- **Short-paths graph initialization** optimized by eliminating unnecessary forced substitutions ([#1988](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1988)), improving performance particularly for projects using ppx_template and other ppx rewriters
- **Refactored index caching** mechanism removes imperative stamped hashtable in favor of clearer sharing-based approach ([#1990](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1990)), better integrating with typer cache and enabling the lazy indexing implementation
- **Menhir parser generation** now uses `--lalr` flag ([#1989](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1989)) for more optimal generated code, aligning with upstream OCaml compiler's parser configuration
repositories.activity_summary: Performance-focused work with index caching refactoring, short-paths optimizations, and parser improvements
repositories.activity:
- [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) refactored **index caching mechanism** replacing imperative stamped hashtable with sharing-based approach ([#1990](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1990)), then implemented **lazy buffer indexing** that only indexes when queries require it ([#1991](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1991)), achieving 25% speedup on error queries
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) optimized **short-paths graph construction** by eliminating forced substitutions ([#1988](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1988)) bringing improvements from oxcaml/merlin, and added **--lalr flag** to Menhir invocations ([#1989](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1989)) for more optimal parser code generation

repositories.discussions_summary: Discussion on cache design led to lazy indexing implementation and performance validation
repositories.notable_discussions:
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) suggested making indexing lazy during review of index caching refactoring, prompting [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) to implement it as trivial follow-up ([#1990](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1990), [#1991](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1991)), with testing confirming ~25% speedup

- **Comprehensive platform documentation** effort expanding with detailed guides covering all OCaml compilation targets from traditional native/bytecode to modern web (JavaScript, WebAssembly) and cloud (unikernels) deployments, providing developers with clear guidance on choosing appropriate toolchains for their use cases
- **Infrastructure transparency** initiative producing detailed articles explaining how OCaml ecosystem services operate, including opam-repository CI pipeline architecture, governance policies, and funding acknowledgments to help community members understand and potentially contribute to essential infrastructure
- **Automated content pipeline** maintenance including fixes for video scraping infrastructure and continuous integration of community blog posts and videos into the OCaml Planet aggregator

repositories.brief_summary: Significant progress on modes, SIMD support, and Unix module annotations with 34 PRs merged and 17 new PRs opened.
repositories.new_features_summary: F16C/FMA intrinsics, domain index API, TLS primitive, quiet flag for ocamldebug, and untagged char range patterns.
repositories.new_features:
- **F16C and FMA SIMD intrinsics** added with new `Float16x8`, `Float16x16`, and `Float16x32` vector types for half-precision floating-point operations, plus fused multiply-add support ([#4964](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4964))
- **Domain index API** exposed via `Domain.self_index()` to get a unique integer identifier for the current domain, in range [0; N-1] where N is the peak number of simultaneously running domains ([#4950](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4950))
- **Thread-local storage primitive** `%tls_get` added for accessing thread-local state blocks, complementing the existing domain-local state ([#4959](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4959))
- **Untagged char range patterns** now supported (e.g., `#'a'..#'z'`) with improved match exhaustion checking for small integers and unboxed ints ([#4729](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4729))
- **Unix module local annotations** added to parameters in functions like `execv`, `execve`, `openfile`, `read`, `write`, `stat`, `lstat`, and many file operations to support locality modes ([#4830](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4830))
- **Quiet flag for ocamldebug** (`-quiet`) suppresses printing while executing initialization files, useful for cleaner startup in scripts ([#4869](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4869))
- **Locking scheme version** added to track runtime locking protocol changes ([#4958](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4958))
- **Stdlib local annotations** now printed for standard library functions to improve visibility of locality mode constraints ([#4943](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4943))
- **Hole expressions** (`Pexp_hole`) now parsed as simple expressions, improving error handling and type checking ([#4956](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4956))
- **Skiplist for natdynlink roots** in the runtime improves performance of dynamic linking ([#4949](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4949))

repositories.brief_summary: Performance improvements in short-paths construction, parser generation, and index caching
repositories.new_features_summary: Performance optimizations for type-checking and parsing with lazy evaluation improvements
repositories.new_features:
- **Short-paths graph construction** no longer forces expensive substitutions, addressing performance issues in large modules especially with ppx_template ([#193](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/193)). This optimization affects `Env.update_short_paths` and improves type-checking and completion query performance by avoiding unnecessary work on large modules
- **Parser generation** now uses `--lalr` flag for menhir invocations, matching the compiler's configuration for improved parser performance ([#194](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/194))
- **Index caching** refactored to use lazy evaluation, with the index buffer only computed when queries actually need it ([#195](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/195)). Changes include replacing `Stamped_hashtable` with `Shape.Uid.Map.t` and making index computation on-demand
repositories.activity_summary: Three performance-focused PRs merged addressing type-checking, parsing, and indexing bottlenecks
repositories.activity:
- **Type-checking performance** improved by removing forced substitutions during short-paths graph construction by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923), reducing overhead observed in real-world codebases where `ocamlmerlin single errors` took double the time compared to the compiler ([#193](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/193))
- **Parser generation optimization** added `--lalr` flag to menhir invocations by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923), aligning with the oxcaml compiler configuration ([#194](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/194)). Credit to [Frédéric Bour](https://github.com/let-def) for identifying this improvement
- **Index computation** made lazy through backporting of upstream changes from [ocaml/merlin#1990](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1990) and [ocaml/merlin#1991](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1991) by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923), eliminating unnecessary index buffer computation for queries that don't require it ([#195](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/195))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on performance optimization through lazy evaluation and reducing unnecessary computation
repositories.emerging_trends:

- **Upstream backporting** from ocaml/merlin continuing to bring improvements to the oxcaml fork while maintaining compatibility
- **Performance profiling** driving targeted optimizations in areas where Merlin showed measurably worse performance than the compiler itself

group_summaries.new_features_summary: Dune portable lockdirs improvements, opam 2.5 release prep with cmdliner vendoring, Merlin 25% speedup, mlx file support in LSP
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Dune package management** made significant progress with error deduplication for portable lockdirs ([ocaml/dune#12684](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12684), [ocaml/dune#12670](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12670)), cross-device link error handling via copy+delete fallback ([ocaml/dune#12649](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12649)), and improved runtest error messages with better hints ([ocaml/dune#12663](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12663))
- **opam 2.5.0-beta1** release preparation included macOS sandbox fix allowing access to `/var/folders/` and `/var/db/mds/` directories ([ocaml/opam#4797](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/4797)), version-equivalent package rename bug fix ([ocaml/opam#6774](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6774)), and AppArmor abi/4.0 support checking ([ocaml/opam#6764](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6764))
- **Merlin performance** improved 25% for error queries through lazy buffer indexing that only performs indexing when queries require it ([ocaml/merlin#1991](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1991)), plus short-paths optimizations eliminating forced substitutions ([ocaml/merlin#1988](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1988))
- **OCaml-LSP mlx support** added full LSP features for `.mlx` files including diagnostics, code actions, hover, formatting via ocamlformat-mlx, and counterpart file discovery ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1528](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1528))
- **Js_of_ocaml PPX fixes** resolved spurious unused variable warnings for `self` in `object%js` ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2128](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2128)) and restored labelled arguments support for methods broken in 6.2.0 ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2126](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2126))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Dune** focused on portable lock directories maturation with 10 PRs merged addressing error handling, cross-device links, and user experience improvements ([ocaml/dune#12684](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12684), [ocaml/dune#12649](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12649)), while [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) identified a performance regression showing 3 orders of magnitude slowdown in no-op builds when using package management ([ocaml/dune#12693](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12693))

- **OCaml-LSP** added comprehensive `.mlx` file support by [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) with formatting integration and full LSP features ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1528](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1528))
- **Js_of_ocaml** maintained PPX reliability with bug fixes for unused variable warnings and labelled arguments while continuing development on effects implementation and WASI runtime ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#1832](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1832), [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#1831](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1831))
- **odoc** saw UI/UX discussions around code block rendering and module navigation improvements with [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) providing technical guidance ([ocaml/odoc#1389](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1389), [ocaml/odoc#1386](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1386))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Mode system maturation, SIMD expansion, and performance optimizations across compiler and tooling with 37 PRs merged.
group_summaries.new_features_summary: F16C/FMA SIMD support, domain index API, TLS primitive, lazy evaluation in Merlin, and untagged char patterns.
group_summaries.new_features:
- **F16C and FMA SIMD intrinsics** added with new `Float16x8`, `Float16x16`, and `Float16x32` vector types for half-precision floating-point operations, plus fused multiply-add support in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4964](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4964) by [Max Slater](https://github.com/TheNumbat)
- **Domain index API** exposed via `Domain.self_index()` to get a unique integer identifier for the current domain, in range [0; N-1] where N is the peak number of simultaneously running domains in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4950](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4950) by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic)
- **Thread-local storage primitive** `%tls_get` added for accessing thread-local state blocks, complementing the existing domain-local state in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4959](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4959) by [Max Slater](https://github.com/TheNumbat)
- **Untagged char range patterns** now supported (e.g., `#'a'..#'z'`) with improved match exhaustion checking for small integers and unboxed ints in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4729](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4729) by [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4)
- **Short-paths graph construction** in Merlin no longer forces expensive substitutions, addressing performance issues in large modules especially with ppx_template in [oxcaml/merlin#193](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/193) by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923)
- **Parser generation** in Merlin now uses `--lalr` flag for menhir invocations, matching the compiler's configuration for improved parser performance in [oxcaml/merlin#194](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/194) by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923)
- **Index caching** in Merlin refactored to use lazy evaluation, with the index buffer only computed when queries actually need it in [oxcaml/merlin#195](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/195) by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923)
- **Unix module local annotations** added to parameters in functions like `execv`, `execve`, `openfile`, `read`, `write`, `stat`, `lstat`, and many file operations to support locality modes in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4830](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4830) by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic)
- **Quiet flag for ocamldebug** (`-quiet`) suppresses printing while executing initialization files, useful for cleaner startup in scripts in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4869](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4869) by [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski)
- **Locking scheme version** added to track runtime locking protocol changes in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4958](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4958)
- **Stdlib local annotations** now printed for standard library functions to improve visibility of locality mode constraints in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4943](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4943)
- **Skiplist for natdynlink roots** in the runtime improves performance of dynamic linking in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4949](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4949)

- Discussion between [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) and [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) on whether the API should recurse into directories by default, with agreement that non-recursive behavior with manual descent allows building recursive functionality on top of the base interface ([ocaml-multicore/eio#821](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/821))
group_summaries.notable_discussions: - API design discussion on incremental directory reading in [ocaml-multicore/eio#821](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/821) between [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) and [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) regarding whether `Eio.Path.walk` should recurse into directories by default, concluding that non-recursive behavior with manual descent provides better flexibility

weekly_summary.new_features:
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **F16C and FMA SIMD intrinsics** added with new `Float16x8`, `Float16x16`, and `Float16x32` vector types for half-precision floating-point operations, plus fused multiply-add support in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4964](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4964) by [Max Slater](https://github.com/TheNumbat)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Domain index API** exposed via `Domain.self_index()` to get a unique integer identifier for the current domain, in range [0; N-1] where N is the peak number of simultaneously running domains in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4950](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4950) by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Thread-local storage primitive** `%tls_get` added for accessing thread-local state blocks, complementing the existing domain-local state in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4959](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4959) by [Max Slater](https://github.com/TheNumbat)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Untagged char range patterns** now supported (e.g., `#'a'..#'z'`) with improved match exhaustion checking for small integers and unboxed ints in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4729](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4729) by [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Unix module local annotations** added to parameters in functions like `execv`, `execve`, `openfile`, `read`, `write`, `stat`, `lstat`, and many file operations to support locality modes in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4830](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4830) by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Quiet flag for ocamldebug** (`-quiet`) suppresses printing while executing initialization files, useful for cleaner startup in scripts in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4869](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4869) by [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Unix library socket API modernization** by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) deprecating `union sock_addr_union` in favor of standard `struct sockaddr_storage` and `socklen_param_type` in favor of `socklen_t`, with backward compatibility macros for C and C++ in [ocaml/ocaml#14310](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14310)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Runtime callback safety fix** by [Max Slater](https://github.com/TheNumbat) preventing segfaults by ensuring C callback mechanism properly calls `caml_continuation_use` when handling continuations, addressing dropped continuation issues in [ocaml/ocaml#14337](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14337)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **GC ephemeron accounting improvements** by [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) removing quadratic term from ephemeron marking work calculation to improve garbage collection pacing accuracy in [ocaml/ocaml#14336](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14336)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **GC work accounting fixes** by [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) correcting domain-local work counter tracking for mark and sweep phases to prevent pacing logic errors in [ocaml/ocaml#14329](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14329)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Runtime header improvements** by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) making `<caml/osdeps.h>` self-standing by adding necessary includes, improving C extension compatibility in [ocaml/ocaml#14342](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14342)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Merlin performance** improved 25% for error queries through lazy buffer indexing that only performs indexing when queries require it in [ocaml/merlin#1991](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1991) by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Merlin short-paths optimization** eliminating forced substitutions in graph construction, addressing performance issues in large modules especially with ppx_template in [ocaml/merlin#1988](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1988) by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Merlin parser generation** now uses `--lalr` flag for menhir invocations, matching the compiler's configuration for improved parser performance in [oxcaml/merlin#194](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/194) by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **OCaml-LSP mlx support** added full LSP features for `.mlx` files including diagnostics, code actions, hover, formatting via ocamlformat-mlx, and counterpart file discovery in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1528](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1528) by [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx)

- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Js_of_ocaml PPX fixes** resolved spurious unused variable warnings for `self` in `object%js` in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2128](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2128) and restored labelled arguments support for methods broken in 6.2.0 in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2126](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2126)
